evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: In early April 2025, ICE began a sweeping and unexplained pattern of terminating the SEVIS records of international students without notice, justification, or individualized process.

extracted.value: In early April 2025, ICE began a sweeping and unexplained pattern of terminating the SEVIS records of international students without notice, justification, or individualized process.

evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: These terminations have affected hundreds if not thousands of students nationwide, regardless of whether they had any adverse immigration or criminal history.

extracted.value: Hundreds if not thousands of students nationwide were affected by these terminations.

evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: University officials were similarly left in the dark, reporting a surge in unexpected SEVIS terminations without any prior warning from DHS or ICE.

extracted.value: University officials were similarly left in the dark, reporting a surge in unexpected SEVIS terminations without any prior warning from DHS or ICE.

evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The plaintiffs in this case—Zhuoer Chen, Mengcheng Yu, Jiarong Ouyang, and Gexi Guo—are all law‑abiding students who have never been convicted of any crime, let alone one implicating public safety or national security.

extracted.value: The plaintiffs—Zhuoer Chen, Mengcheng Yu, Jiarong Ouyang, and Gexi Guo—are all law‑abiding students who have never been convicted of any crime, let alone one implicating public safety or national security.

evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The plaintiffs have complied with the terms of their student visas, maintained academic standing, and contributed to their schools and communities.

extracted.value: The plaintiffs have complied with the terms of their student visas, maintained academic standing, and contributed to their schools and communities.

evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The terminations were arbitrary and capricious, violating the Administrative Procedure Act.

extracted.value: The terminations were arbitrary and capricious, violating the Administrative Procedure Act.

evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The lawsuit seeks declaratory and injunctive relief to halt this unlawful pattern of SEVIS record terminations, restore Plaintiffs’ legal status, and prevent further irreparable harm.

extracted.value: The plaintiffs seek declaratory and injunctive relief to halt the unlawful pattern of SEVIS termination.

evidence.text: Plaintiff Zhuoer Chen is a Chinese F-1 student seeking a master’s degree in architecture from the University of California at Berkeley. Chen is scheduled to present her final research and graduate in May 2025.

extracted.value: Plaintiff Zhuoer Chen is a Chinese F-1 student seeking a master’s degree in architecture from the University of California at Berkeley and scheduled to present her final research and graduate in May 2025.

evidence.text: the Court follows two other judges in this district that have granted F-1 student plaintiffs temporary relief.

extracted.value: The Court follows two other judges in this district that have granted F-1 student plaintiffs temporary relief (see 4:25-cv-03140-JSW, Dkt. No. 16; 5:25-cv-03244-NW, Dkt. No. 13).

evidence.source_document: First Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Ms. Chen received notice that her SEVIS record was terminated by DHS on or about April 8th, 2025, without prior warning or opportunity to contest the decision.

extracted.value: Ms. Chen received notice that her SEVIS record was terminated by DHS on or about April 8th, 2025, without prior warning or opportunity to contest the decision.

evidence.source_document: First Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Ms. Yu’s SEVIS record was abruptly terminated in April 2025 without any stated legal basis.

extracted.value: Ms. Yu’s SEVIS record was abruptly terminated in April 2025 without any stated legal basis, jeopardizing her studies and future work prospects.

evidence.source_document: First Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Mr. Ouyang’s SEVIS record was abruptly terminated in April 2025, with no prior notice, hearing, or opportunity to contest the decision.

extracted.value: Mr. Ouyang’s SEVIS record was abruptly terminated in April 2025, with no prior notice, hearing, or opportunity to contest the decision.

evidence.source_document: First Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Ms. Tao’s SEVIS status was not restored and her F-1 visa was cancelled on April 10th, 2025.

extracted.value: Ms. Tao’s SEVIS status was not restored and her F-1 visa was cancelled on April 10th, 2025, preventing her from continuing studies and receiving funding.

evidence.source_document: First Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Mr. Wu’s SEVIS status was terminated on April 8th, 2025, and his F-1 visa was cancelled on April 10th, 2025.

extracted.value: Mr. Wu’s SEVIS status was terminated on April 8th, 2025, and his F-1 visa was cancelled on April 10th, 2025, without restoration.

evidence.source_document: First Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Ms. Li’s SEVIS status was terminated on April 8th, 2025, following a notice from the U.S. Embassy in Tokyo and subsequent notification from USC that her status had been terminated.

extracted.value: Ms. Li’s SEVIS status was terminated on April 8th, 2025, following a notice from the U.S. Embassy in Tokyo and subsequent notification from USC that her status had been terminated.
